H0.text: Most have cells that are not able to exchange gases with the outside environment, which is why multicellular organisms need transport systems.

H1.text: Most have cells that are unable to grow and survive in their environment, which is why multicellular organisms need transport systems.

H2.text: Most have cells that need food from sources outside their environment, so multicellular organisms need transport systems.

H3.text: Most have cells that require more energy to survive than singleâ€‘celled organisms, which explains why multicellular organisms need transport systems.

A4.text: Oxygen is poorly soluble in water.

A5.text: This means that when oxygen is taken up from the water in contact with a gas exchanger, it is replaced considerably more slowly by the oxygen from the oxygen-rich regions small distances away from the exchanger than would have occurred in air.
